metadata.Title: CVE-2021-43531 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When a user loaded a Web Extensions context menu, the Web Extension could access the post-redirect URL of the element clicked. If the Web Extension lacked the WebRequest permission for the hosts involved in the redirect, this would be a same-origin-violation leaking data the Web Extension should have access to. This was fixed to provide the pre-redirect URL. This is related to CVE-2021-43532 but in the context of Web Extensions. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 94.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-43531` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 94.0+build3-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
firefox-geckodriver - 94.0+build3-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 94.0+build3-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '94.0+build3-0ubuntu0.21.10.1').
